Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2010 03:59AM makakilomeg wrote: I had something similar - microcalcifications that needed to be biopsied.  I was OK with that, until I found out that they put you in the mammogram machine for 20-25 minutes to position and stabilize the breast for the needle.  I lost 8 lbs. worrying about how I was going to stand it.  My regular gynecologist said he understood my feelings but it was something that had to be done.  Thankfully, I got referred to a breast surgeon first, and he heard how scared I was (to the point of not wanting to do it or any more mammograms) - and he offered to prescribe Vicodin for the pain and Valium for the anxiety.  I took them about an hour apart, and then was CALM and PAIN-FREE during the whole process.  My point is - if you are avoiding this due to fear, ask for meds to get you thru it.  TAKE CHARGE AND TAKE CARE OF YOURSELF!!!
